summary: The Stop Child Hunger Act of 2025 (S. 1622) amends the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to expand the summer electronic benefits transfer (EBT) program to include school closure periods. It provides benefits during school closures, defines 'school closure period', and outlines administrative expense reimbursement for states.  The bill also establishes grants for states to support data system development related to the program's implementation, allocating $50 million for this purpose.
